metadata.description: Most essential Spanish verbs - fundamental for basic communication

present.english: I speak Spanish with my friends.
present.subject: yo

present.spanish: Hablas muy bien inglés para ser estudiante.
present.english: You (informal) speak English very well for a student.
present.subject: tú

present.english: We talk on the phone every day.
present.subject: nosotros

present.english: You all (vosotros) talk a lot at the table.
present.subject: vosotros

present.english: You all speak Spanish at home.
present.subject: ustedes

preterite.spanish: Hablé con el director sobre mi proyecto.
preterite.english: I spoke with the director about my project.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.spanish: Hablaste con mucha pasión sobre el tema.
preterite.english: You (vos) spoke with great passion about the topic.

preterite.english: I spoke with my mother yesterday.
preterite.subject: yo

preterite.subject: tú

preterite.subject: ella

preterite.english: We spoke in Spanish during class.
preterite.subject: nosotros

preterite.english: You all (vosotros) talked about your plans.
preterite.subject: vosotros

future.subject: yo

future.english: You all (vosotros) will speak in public.
future.subject: vosotros

present-progressive._comment: PODER is a modal verb that does not have natural present-progressive forms. 'Estar pudiendo' is grammatically possible but extremely unnatural in Spanish. Modal verbs express states of ability/possibility rather than ongoing actions. For learning purposes, this section is intentionally left empty.

going-to.spanish: Vas a poder venir a casa cuando quieras.
going-to.english: You (vos)'re going to be able come home whenever you (vos) want.
going-to.subject: vos

going-to.spanish: Vamos a poder terminar el trabajo antes del viernes.
going-to.english: We're going to be able finish the work before Friday.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.english: I'm going to be able to help you.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: I am going to be able to help you.
going-to.subject: yo

going-to.english: You (informal) are going to be able to do it.
going-to.subject: tú

going-to.english: She is going to be able to come.
going-to.subject: ella

going-to.english: He is going to be able to study.
going-to.subject: él

going-to.english: We are going to be able to leave.
going-to.subject: nosotros

going-to.english: You (formal) are going to be able to rest.
going-to.subject: usted

present-perfect.spanish: Puedes venir a casa cuando quieras.

present-perfect.subject: vos

quality.fix_issue: English meaning incorrect + Spanish doesn't fit perfect tense

present-progressive._comment: SER verb does not have natural present-progressive forms. 'Estar siendo' is grammatically possible but extremely unnatural in Spanish. SER expresses permanent/essential characteristics that don't work well in progressive aspect. For learning purposes, this section is intentionally left empty.

present-progressive._comment: ESTAR verb does not have natural present-progressive forms. 'Estar estando' is grammatically impossible (double progressive). ESTAR is typically used as an auxiliary verb for progressive constructions with other verbs, not as the main verb in progressive form. For learning purposes, this section is intentionally left empty.
